GEORGII IV. REGIS.

Cap. 4.

An Act for dividing, inclosing, and improving a certain Moor or Open Pasture called Hawdon Field, otherwise Frown Moor, in the Parish of Warden in the County of Northumberland.

[2d May 1823.]

WHEREAS the Most Noble Hugh Duke of Northumberland is seised of or entitled to the Soil of a certain Moor or Open Pasture called Hawdon Field, otherwise Brown Moor, in the Parish of Warden, in the County of Northumberland, and all Mines, Minerals, and Quarries within and under the same; and which said Moor or Open Pasture contains by Admeasurement Five hundred and forty Acres One Rood and Thirty Perches; and the said Duke of Northumberland is also entitled to all Rights of Pasturage in and over the same, except such Rights of Pasturage as belong to other Persons, as herein-after mentioned: And whereas George Dodd of Pitland Hills, in the said County of Northumberland, Yeoman, as Owner of certain Lands and Grounds called Ridley's Close, adjoining the said Moor or Open Pasture on the East or Northeast Side thereof, is entitled, in respect of the said Lands and Grounds called Ridley's Close, to depasture Sixteen Stints on the same Moor or Open Pasture called Hawdon Field, otherwise Brown Moor, but has no farther or other Interest therein: And whereas [Private.0 an

54

4° GEORGII IV. Cap A.

an Act was passed in the Forty-first Year of the Reign of His late 41G.3.C. 109. Majesty, intituled An Act for consolidating in One Act certain Provisions usually inserted in Acts of Inclosure; and for facilitating the Mode of proving the several Facts usually required on the passing of such Acts: And whereas an Act was passed in the First and Second c*23>G 4 Years of the Reign of His present Majesty, intituled An Act to amend the Law respecting the inclosing of Open Fields, Pastures, MoorSy CommonSy and Waste Lands in England: And whereas it would be advantageous to the Parties interested in the said Moor or Open Pasture if the same were divided, allotted, and inclosed, in the Manner herein-after mentioned; but inasmuch as the same cannot be effected without the Aid and Authority of Parliament: May it therefore please Your Majesty that it may be enacted; and be it enacted by the King’s most Excellent Majesty, by and with the Advice and Consent of the Lords Spiritual and Temporal, and Commons, in this present Parliament assembled, and by the Authority of the same, That the said Moor or Open Pasture shall, as soon as conveniently may be, be set out, divided, and allotted unto the said Duke of Northumberland and George Dodd, and such other Person or Persons (if any) as are or may be interested therein, according to Commission- their several and respective Rights and Interests, by William Bates ers. of Hallington ‘in the County of Northumberland, Gentleman, and

John Leighton of Broomhouses in the same County, Gentleman, who are hereby appointed Commissioners for that Purpose, and for carrying the several Purposes of this Act into Execution, and under and subject to the Directions herein contained, and to such of the Rules, Orders, Regulations, Restrictions, and Directions respectively contained in the said recited Acts, as are not repugnant to or varied, or controlled by, or otherwise provided for by this Act; and that it shall be lawful for the said Commissioners, or either of them, or for any Justice of the Peace for the County of Northumberland, to administer to the said Commissioners or either of them, the Oath or Affirmation directed by the said first recited Act to be taken by Commissioners.

II. And be it further enacted, That if the said Commissioners of future 1 hereby appointed, or either of them, shall die or shall neglect to act Commission- for the Space of Three Calendar Months, when Occasion shall require ers- their Attendance on the Business hereby committed to their Charge,

or shall refuse to act, or be rendered incapable of acting by Sickness or by any other Cause whatsoever, before the Powers and Authorities hereby and by the said herein-before recited Acts vested in them shall be carried into Execution, a new Commissioner or Commissioners shall and may be appointed and nominated in the Place or Places of him or them so dying, neglecting, or refusing to act, or rendered incapable as aforesaid, in Manner following; that is to say, in case the said William Bates shall die, neglect, or refuse, or become incapable to act as aforesaid, the Owner of the Soil of the said Moor or Open Pasture, or the Guardian or Guardians of any Owner of the Soil of the said Moor or Open Pasture, being an Infant or Infants, under the Age of Twenty-one Years, for the Time being, shall and may, by any Instrument in Writing under his or her Hand, nominate and appoint a proper Person, not being beneficially interested in the

III. And be it further enacted, That the said Commissioners shall Power to and may, and they are hereby authorized and empowered to appoint appoint a a Clerk or Clerks to assist them in carrying this Act into Execution, c,erk-and from Time to Time to remove and appoint another or others, in his or their Room, as to the said Commissioners shall seem meet; and to pay to such Clerk or Clerks all such fair and reasonable Charges and Disbursements as the said Commissioners shall judge right and proper.

IV. And for the Purpose of setting and determining any Difference Umpire to be or Dispute that may arise between the said Commissioners, touching appointed-or concerning any of the Matters or Things to be by them done and performed in pursuance of this Act, or of the said recited Acts, be it further enacted, That the said Commissioners shall and they are hereby required, immediately after the taking and subscribing the Oath or Affirmation by the said first recited Act directed to be by them taken and subscribed, by Writing under their Hands, to choose, nominate, and appoint some fit, proper, and skilful Person (not interested in the said Lands and Grounds, and not being an Agent to, or Father, Son, or Brother of any Person so interested), who shall be willing and consent to act as Umpire; and such Umpire is hereby authorized and required to hear and determine any such Difference or Dispute as may arise between the said Commissioners, touching

V. Provided always, and be it further enacted, That in case the Person so nominated and appointed by the said Commissioners or Umpire shall die or refuse to act, or become incapable of acting as aforesaid, then and in any such Case it shall be lawful for the said Commissioners to nominate and appoint one other fit and proper Person to act as Umpire in the Room or Stead of the Person so dying, refusing to act, or becoming incapable of acting, and so from Time to Time as often as any Person so nominated and appointed an Umpire shall die or refuse to act, or become incapable of acting; and in case any such Umpire shall neglect to settle and determine any Difference or Dispute within Thirty Days after the same shall have been referred to him by the said Commissioners, such Neglect shall be and be deemed and taken to be a Refusal to act within the Intent and Meaning of this Act.

VI. Provided always, and be it further enacted, That no Person shall be capable of acting in the Execution of this Act as Umpire, until he shall have taken and subscribed the Oath or Affirmation following; (that is to say,)

VII. And be it further enacted, That true and exact Surveys and Admeasurements shall be taken, and fair Plans made, of the said Moor or Open Pasture so intended to be divided and allotted, if the said Commissioners for the Time being shall not be satisfied with the Map or Survey made at the Time of passing this Act, some Time before the First Day of July One thousand eight hundred and twenty-three, or as soon after as conveniently may be, by Thomas Bell of the Town and County of Newcastle-upo?i-Tyne, Land Surveyor, or in case of the Death, Neglect, Refusal, or Incapacity by Sickness, or any other Cause whatsoever, of the said Thomas Belly for the Space

VIII. Allowance to Commission-

IX. And be it further enacted, That the said Commissioners and Umpire shall be paid or allowed, by the Parties interested in the said Division, the Sum of Three Guineas each (and no more) for every ers> Umpire, Day they shall attend and be employed at any Meeting or Meetings, and Survey°l or going to or returning from thence, or otherwise howsoever, in executing the Powers and Authorities hereby given to them, including their Expences; and the Surveyor shall be paid such Sum or Sums of Money for Plans, Maps, Surveys, and Attendances, as are usually paid on the Division of Commons.

And be it further enacted, That the said Commissioners shall Notice of and they are hereby required to cause Public Notice to be given upon Meeting^ some Sunday before Divine Service, by Writing to be affixed on the principal Outer Door of the Parish Church of Warden aforesaid, of the Time and Place of their First and every other Attendance for the Execution of this Act, at least Ten Days before any such Meeting shall be holden, (Meetings by Adjournment only excepted); and the said Commissioners shall and may adjourn any such Meeting from Time to Time as they shall see Occasion, for the further and due Execution of this Act; and all the Attendances of the said Commis-[Privatef] p sioners

XI. And be it further enacted, That if any Dispute or Difference shall arise between any of the Parties interested in the said intended Division and Inclosure, touching or concerning the Rights, Interests, Shares, and Proportions which they or any of them shall have or claim to have of and in the said Moor or Open Pasture hereby directed to be divided and allotted, or touching or concerning any other Matter or Thing relating to the said Division an4 Inclosure, it shall be lawful for the said Commissioners, and they are hereby authorized to examine into, hear, and determine the same : Provided always, that nothing herein contained shall authorize the said Commissioners to determine the Title to any Messuages, Lands, Tenements, or Hereditaments whatsoever: Provided also, that nothing in this Act contained shall extend to enable the said Commissioners to determine the Right between any Parties contrary to the Possession of such Parties; but in case the said Commissioners shall be of opinion against the Right of the Person or Persons so in Possession, they shall forbear to make any Determination thereupon, until the Possession shall have been given up by such Person or Persons, or recovered from such Person or Persons by Ejectment, or other due Course of Law.

XII. And be it further enacted, That the said Commissioners shall and they are hereby empowered, at their Discretion, upon Request made to them by the Party or Parties in whose Favour they shall make their Award or Determination, to order and adjudge such Costs and Charges as they shall think reasonable, for the Use and Benefit of such Party or Parties, upon or against the Person or Persons, Body or Bodies Politic, Corporate, or Collegiate, whose Claim or Claims, Objection or Objections, Complaint or Complaints, shall be thereby disallowed (as the Case shall happen), and by Warrant under the Hands of the said Commissioners to levy such Costs and Charges by Distress and Sale of the Goods and Chattels of such last-mentioned Person or Persons, Body or Bodies Politic, Corporate, or Collegiate, together with the Charges of such Distress and Sale; and in case there shall be no Goods and Chattels whereby to levy the same, then and in such Case it shall be lawful for the Person or Persons, Body or Bodies Politic, Corporate, or Collegiate, in whose favour such Costs shall be awarded, to recover the same by Action or Actions of Debt or on the Case, in which it shall be sufficient for the Plaintiff’ to declare that the Defendant is indebted to him in the Sum specified in the Order of Adjudication made by the said Commissioners, in consequence of such Order of Adjudication, without setting forth any other Proceedings therein had.

XIII. Provided always, and be it further enacted, That in case any Person or Persons, Body or Bodies Politic, Corporate, or Collegiate, interested or claiming to be interested in the said intended Division and Inclosure, shall be dissatisfied with any Determination of the said Commissioners or Umpire, touching or concerning any Claim or Claims to any Right of Common of Pasture, or other Right or Interest in, over, or upon the said Moor or Open Pasture herein directed to be

and the Defendant or Defendants in such Action or Actions shall, and he or they is and are hereby required to name an Attorney or Attornies, who shall appear thereto, or file common Bail, and accept One or more Issue or Issues, whereby such Claim or Claims, and the Right or Rights thereby insisted upon, may be tried and determined (such Issue or Issues to be settled by the proper Officer of the Court in which the said Action shall be commenced, in case the Parties shall differ about the same), and may be tried at the then next or the following Assizes for the County of Northumberland after the Commencement of such Action; and the Verdict or Verdicts which shall be given in such Action or Actions shall be final, binding, and conclusive upon all and every Person and Persons, Body and Bodies Politic, Corporate, and Collegiate, unless the Court in which such Action or Actions shall be brought shall set aside such Verdict or Verdicts, and order a new Trial to be had therein, which it shall be lawful for the Court to do, as is usual in other Cases; and after such Verdict or Verdicts shall be obtained, and not set aside by the Court, the said Commissioners or Umpire shall and they are hereby required to act in conformity thereto, and to allow or disallow the Claim or Claims thereby determined, according to the Event of such Trial or Trials : Provided always, that the Determination of the said Commissioners or Umpire, touching such Claim or Claims, or other Rights or Interests in, over, or upon the said Moor or Open Pasture hereby directed to be divided and allotted, or any Part thereof, which shall not be objected to in due Time, or being objected to, the Party or Parties objecting not causing such Action at Law to be brought within the Time before limited, or not proceeding therein as aforesaid, shall be final and conclusive on all Parties.

XXIII. Provided always, and be it further enacted, That nothing &c. not to be in this Act contained shall extend or be construed, deemed, adjudged, or taken to make void, or in any wise affect any Grant, Assurance, Limitation ot Use, Declaration of Trust, or any Deed, Settlement, or Lease whatsoever, or to prejudice any Person or Persons having any Right or Claim of Dower, Jointure, Portion, Debt, Rent, Incumbrance, or other Claim or Demand out of, upon, or affecting any of the Lands or Grounds hereby intended to be divided and inclosed; but that the Lands and Grounds so to be allotted shall, immediately after such Allotments are made as aforesaid, respectively be, remain, and enure, and be held and enjoyed, and the Persons to whom the same shall be allotted shall from thenceforth stand and be seised and possessed thereof respectively, to such and the same Uses, Trusts, Estates, and Purposes, and subject to such and the same Wills, Limitations, Conditions, Settlements, Provisoes, Reversions, Remainders, Powers, Remedies, Leases, Debts, Charges, and Incumbrances, as the several Lands, Tenements, and Hereditaments, in respect whereof such Allotments shall be made or taken as aforesaid, are now limited, or shall be subject and liable to at the Time of such Division and Allotment.

Expences of

XXIV. And be it further enacted, That the Charges and Expences the Act. of soliciting, obtaining, and passing this Act, and of surveying, planning, and measuring, dividing and allotting the said Moor or Open Pasture, and of making Highways or Roads, and of all other the Charges and Expences incident to or attending the Execution of this and the said recited Acts, and not herein otherwise directed to be paid, shall be borne, paid, and defrayed by the Persons to whom any Allotment or Allotments of the said Moor or Open Pasture shall be respectively made, his, her, or their Heirs, in proportion to the real Value of their respective Allotments so to be settled and ascertained by the said Commissioners; and the several and respective Shares and Proportions of all such Fees, Payments, Charges, and Expences as aforesaid, shall be payable and paid by such Persons respectively, to such Person or Persons, at such Time or Times, as shall by the said Commissioners, either before or after the Execution of their Award as aforesaid, be ordered, directed and appointed, in Writing under their Hands respectively, Twenty Days before the Time appointed for

Act, being a Tenant for Life or in Tail, and also to and for the Husband, Guardian, Committee, Trustee, Attornies or Agents of the said Persons interested as shall be under Coverture, Minor, Lunatic, or beyond the Seas, or otherwise incapable of acting for himself or herself for the Time being, or for the said Commissioners, (in case the said Parties interested in the Division intended to be hereby made shall refuse or neglect), by Writing under their Hands and Seals, from Time to Time to charge the Lands and Grounds which shall be allotted and assigned to him or her by virtue of this Act, with such Sum or Sums of Money, to be applied for the Purposes before mentioned (and for no other), as the said Commissioners shall direct and appoint, not exceeding Five Pounds for each Acre of the Lands and Grounds so to be allotted; and for securing the Repayment of such Sum or Sums of Money with Interest, the Person borrowing the same respectively may, by Indenture or other Deed under his or her Hand and Seal, attested by Two or more credible Witnesses, grant, mortgage, demise, and assure the said Lands and Grounds intended to be divided and allotted as aforesaid, or any Part or Parts thereof, for any Term or Number of Years, or otherwise, unto or in trust for such Person or Persons as shall advance and lend such Money; so as every such Grant, Mortgage, Demise, or other Security, shall be made with a Proviso or Condition for Re-entry, or to cease and be void, or with an express Trust to be assigned, surrendered, or re-conveyed, when such Sum or Sums of Money thereby to be secured, with the Interest thereof, shall be fully paid and satisfied, and do also contain a Covenant to pay and keep down the Interest of the Money thereby secured during his, her, or their respective Lives, so that no Person afterwards becoming possessed of any such Lands or Grounds shall be liable to pay any further or larger Arrear of Interest than for One Year preceding the Time that the Title to such Possession shall have commenced; and that every Grant, Mortgage, or Demise so to be made, shall be good, valid, and effectual in the Law for the Purposes thereby intended.

XXVIII. And be it further enacted, That once at least in every Year during the Execution of this Act, (such Year to be computed from the Day of the passing of this Act) the said Commissioners shall and they are hereby required to make a just and true Statement or Account of all Sums of Money by them received and expended in the Execution of this Act; and such Statement and Account, wrhen so made out, together with the Vouchers relating thereto, shall be by them laid before One of His Majesty's Justices of the Peace for the said County of Northumberland, (not interested in the Inclosure) to be by him examined and balanced; and such Balance shall by such Justice be stated in the Book of Accounts to be kept in the Office of the Clerk to the said Commissioners; and no Charge or Item in such Accounts shall be binding on the Parties concerned, or valid in Law, unless the same shall have been duly allowed by such Justice.

XXIX. And be it further enacted, That if any Person or Persons shall think himself, herself, or themselves aggrieved by any thing done or omitted to be done in pursuance of the said recited Acts or of this Act (other than and except such Acts, Orders, and Determinations of the said Commissioners or Umpire as in and by this and the said recited Acts are directed to be binding and conclusive, or where an Issue at Law shall be tried as herein-before mentioned), he, she, or they may appeal to the General or Quarter Sessions of the Peace to be hoi den for the said County of Northumberland within Six Calendar Months next after the Cause of Complaint shall have arisen, on giving to the said Commissioners, and to the Party or Parties concerned, Thirty Days Notice in Writing of such Appeal, and of the Matter thereof; and the Justices, not interested in the Premises, in their said General or Quarter Sessions, are hereby required to hear and determine the Matter of every such Appeal, and to make such Order therein, and award such Costs and Damages, as to them in their Discretion shall seem reasonable, and by their Order or Warrant to levy the Costs and Damages which shall be so awarded, by Distress and Sale of the Goods and Chattels of the Party or Parties liable to pay the same, rendering the Overplus (if any) on Demand to the Owner or Owners of such Goods and Chattels, after deducting the reasonable Charges of such Warrant, Distress, and Sale; and the Determination of the said Justices shall be final and conclusive on all Parties concerned, and shall not be removed by Certiorari, or any other Writ or Process whatsoever, into any of His Majesty's Courts of Record at Westminster or elsewhere; but in case such Appeal shall appear to the said Justices to be frivolous, vexatious, or without Foundation, then the said Justices shall award such

XXX. Provided also, and be it further enacted, That nothing in this Act contained shall be construed to defeat, lessen, or prejudice the Right, Title, and Interest of the Owner of the Soil of the said Moor or Open Pasture hereby directed to be divided and inclosed, his or her Heirs and Assigns, of, in, and to all Mines, Minerals, and Quarries, of what Nature or Kind soever, lying or being within or under the said Moor or Open Pasture hereby intended to be divided and inclosed, in as full, ample, and beneficial Manner to all Intents and Purposes as he or she could or might have held and enjoyed the same if this Act had not been passed; and that the Owner of the Soil of the said Moor or Open Pasture, his or her Heirs and Assigns, and bis or her Tenants and Lessees, shall and may from Time to Time, and at all Times hereafter, have, hold, win, work, and enjoy exclusively all Mines, Minerals, and Quarries, of what Nature or Kind soever, within and under the said Moor or Open Pasture hereby directed to be divided and inclosed, and within and under every Part thereof respectively, and the Allotments thereof in pursuance of this Act, together with all convenient Ways and Wayleaves, and also Liberty of making and repairing Waggon Ways and other Ways in, through, over, and along the same, or any Part thereof and also for searching for, winning, and working the said Mines, Minerals, and Quarries, and leading and carrying away the Lead Ore, Lead, Coals, Stones, Fossils, and other Things to be gotten thereout, or out of any other Mines, Minerals, Quarries, or Collieries belonging to the Owner of the Soil of the said Moor or Open Pasture, his or her Heirs or Assigns, and of making Pits, Shafts, and Sumps, Pit Rooms and Heap Rooms, Drifts, Levels, and Watercourses, and of repairing, amending, and upholding the same, and of erecting, building, and using Houses, Drawkilns, Erections, Buildings, Fire-Engines and other Engines, Mills, and other Erections and Buildings, and of altering, changing, and pulling down and carrying away the same, or all or any of the Materials thereof, at their free Will and Pleasure, and to do, execute, and perform all such other Works, Acts, Deeds, Matters and Things, either now in use or hereafter to be invented, as shall or may be necessary or convenient for the full and complete Working, Use, and Enjoyment of such Mines, Minerals, and Quarries hereby reserved, in as full, ample, and beneficial a Manner to all Intents and Purposes as they might or could have done in case this Act had not been passed.

ANNO QUARTO

GEORGII IV. REGIS.

Cap.

An Act to amend an Act, made in the Forty-second Year of the Reign of His late Majesty King George the Third, for dividing, allotting, inclosing, and appropriating the Commons, Waste Grounds and Mosses, within the Manor or Township of Egton with Newland, in the Parish of Ulverston, in the County Palatine of Lancaster.

[12th 1823.]

WHEREAS by an Act made and passed in the Forty-second Year of the Reign of His late Majesty King George the Third, intituled An Act for dividing, allotting, inclosing, and appropri- 42G.3. c. 41, ating the Commons, Waste Grounds and Mosses within the Manor or Township of Egton-with-NewIand, in the Parish of Ulverston, in the County Palatine of Lancaster, the Commissioners thereby appointed for carrying the said Act into execution were by the said Act authorized and empowered to sell the Herbage of several Parcels of Peat Moss, marked or meered out, and the Soil beneath the same, and the Encroachments which they should find to have been made on the Commons, Waste Grounds and Mosses within Twenty Years then last past (except as in the said Act is excepted), and also such Parts and Parcels of the said Commons and Waste Grounds as, together with the Herbage of the said Parcels of Peat Moss and Soil beneath the same, and the said Encroachments,

Private.] e would

70

41 G.3.C. 109.

Former Act to be in force.

4° GEORGII IV. Cap.5.

would in the Judgment of the said Commissioners produce by such Sales Money sufficient to defray the Charges and Expences incident to and attending the obtaining and passing the said recited Act, and of effectuating the said Inclosure, and other the Purposes in the said recited Act particularly mentioned j and if there should be any Surplus of the said Money, such Surplus should be applied in Manner directed by an Act passed in the Forty-first Year of the Reign of his said late Majesty, intituled An Act for consolidating in One Act certain Provisions usually inserted in Acts of Inclosure, and for facilitating the Mode of proving the several Facts usually required on the passing of such Acts: And whereas the said Commissioners have sold several Parcels of Peat Moss, Encroachments, and Common and Waste Grounds, as authorized and empowered by the said recited Act of the Forty-second Year of the Reign of His said late Majesty, and have received divers Sums of Money in Payment of the same : And whereas the said Commissioners have completed the Division and Inclosure of the said Commons, Waste Grounds and Mosses, and effectually completed all and every Matter and Thing ordered or directed, or necessary or requisite to be done under or by virtue of the said recited Act of the Forty-second Year of the Reign of His said late Majesty, and made up an Account of all Monies by them received and expended in the Execution of the said last-mentioned Act; by which there appears to be in the Hands of the said Commissioners a Balance or Surplus Sum of Money, amounting to Two thousand seven hundred Pounds, or thereabouts: And whereas by the said Act of the Forty-first Year of the Reign of His said late Majesty, it is directed that the Balance of the Money received by the Commissioners upon the final Settlement of Accounts should be immediately repaid to the Land Owners, in proportion to the Sums respectively paid by them : And whereas the Land Owners interested in the said Inclosure have not paid any Sum or Sums of Money for or on account of the Charges or Expences mentioned in the said Act of the Forty-second Year of the Reign of His said late Majesty, or in any way relating to the said Inclosure : And whereas by the Sale of such Lands the several Allotments to be made by the said recited Act of the Forty-second Year of the Reign of His said late Majesty were proportionably decreased; it is therefore just and equitable that the said Surplus Money should be divided amongst the several Persons interested in the said Division and Inclosure, in proportion to their respective Rights and Interests therein; but as the same cannot be effectuated without the Aid and Authority of Parliament, may it therefore please Your Majesty that it may be enacted; and be it enacted by the King’s most Excellent Majesty, by and with the Advice and Consent of the Lords Spiritual and Temporal, and Commons, in this present Parliament assembled, and by the Authority of the same, That the said recited Act of the Forty-second Year of the Reign of His late Majesty, and all and every the Clauses, Powers, Exemptions, Rules, Remedies, Regulations, Penalties, Forfeitures, Articles, Matters and Things whatsoever therein contained, and the said recited Act of the Forty-first Year of the Reign of His said late Majesty, and all and every the Powers and Provisions therein contained (save and except such as are varied, altered, or repealed by, or as are repugnant to the Powers and Provisions of the said first-recited Act) shall be and the same is and are hereby declared to be in as full Force and Effect, and shall be as good, valid, and effectual for carrying this Act

II. And be it further enacted, That all Persons and Bodies Corporate or Politic, who shall have or claim any Right or Interest to or in any Part or Share in the said Surplus Money, shall deliver or cause to be delivered to the Commissioners appointed lor the Execution of the said recited Act of the Forty-second Year of the Reign of His late Majesty, or to the surviving Commissioners or Commissioner, at some Meeting to be appointed by such Commissioners or Commissioner for the Purpose, of which Ten Days Notice shall be given, as directed by the said recited Act of the Forty-second Year of the Reign of His said late Majesty, or within such further Time, if any, as such Commissioners or Commissioner shall for some special reason think proper to allow for that Purpose, an Account or Description in Writing, signed by them or their respective Husbands, Guardians, Trustees, Committees or Agents, of such their respective Rights or Interests, and also in what Rights and for what Estates and Interests they claim the same respectively; or on Non-compliance therewith, every of them making default therein shall, as far only as respects any Claim so neglected to be delivered, be totally barred and excluded of and from all Right and Interest in or to the said Surplus Money, and of and from all Benefit and Advantage in or to any Share or Part thereof; all which said Claims or Accounts shall at all seasonable Times, until after the Division of the said Surplus Money, be open to the Inspection and Perusal of all Parties interested or claiming to be interested in the Premises, their respective Agents or Attornies, who may take Copies thereof or Extracts therefrom respectively; and if any Person or Persons, or Bodies Politic or Corporate, interested or claiming to be interested in the Premises, shall have any Objection to offer to any such Account or Claim, the Particulars of such Objection shall be reduced into Writing, and signed by them or their respective Husbands, Guardians, Trustees, Committees or Agents, and shall be delivered to such Commissioners or Commissioner at or before some other Meeting of such Commissioners or Commissioner, to be by them or him appointed for that Purpose; and no such Objection shall afterwards be received, unless for some legal Disability or special Cause, to be allowed by such Commissioners or Commissioner.

VI. Provided always, and be it further enacted, That in case any Person or Persons, Body or Bodies Politic, Corporate, or Collegiate, interested or claiming to be interested in the said Surplus Money, or any Part thereof, shall be dissatisfied with any Determination of such Commissioners or Commissioner, or Umpire, touching or concerning any Claim or Claims to any Rights or Interests in or to the said Surplus Money, or any Part thereof, then and in every such case it shall be lawful for such Person or Persons, or Body or Bodies Politic, Corporate, or Collegiate, so dissatisfied with the Determination of such Commissioners or Commissioner or Umpire, to cause an Action to be brought upon a feigned Issue against the Person or Persons, or Body or Bodies Politic, Corporate, or Collegiate, in whose Favour such Determination shall have been made, and within Three Calendar Months next after such Determination of such Commissioners or Commissioner or Umpire shall have been notified in Writing to the Party or Parties against whom such Determination shall have been so made, or to his, her, or their known Agent or Attorney; and the Person or Persons, or Body or Bodies Politic, Corporate, or Collegiate, so dissatisfied as aforesaid, shall proceed to a Trial at Law of the Matters so determined by such Commissioners or Commissioner or Umpire, at the then next Assizes to be holden for the said County of Lancaster, or at the Assizes next following the said then next Assizes to be holden for the same County, after such Action or Actions shall have been commenced; and the Defendant or Defendants in such Action or Actions shall, and he, she, or they is and are hereby required to name an Attorney or Attornies, who shall file Common Bail, or appear thereto and accept One or more Issue or Issues, whereby such Claim or Claims and the Right or Rights thereby insisted on may be tried and determined, such Issue or Issues to be settled by the proper Officer of the Court in which the said Action or Actions shall be commenced, in case the Parties shall differ about the same-, and the Verdict or Verdicts which shall be given in such Action or Actions shall be final, binding, and conclusive upon all and every Person and Persons, Body or Bodies Politic, Corporate, and Collegiate whomsoever, unless the Court wherein such Action or Actions shall be brought shall set aside such Verdict or Verdicts, and order a new Trial to be had thereon, which it shall be lawful for the Court to do if the said Court shall think proper; and each and every of the Parties in such Action or Actions, for whom or in whose Favour the same shall be determined, shall be entitled to his, her, or their Costs of Suit against the others or other of them, to be taxed by the proper Officer of the Court in which such Action or Actions shall be brought; and after such Verdict or Verdicts, Judgment or Judgments, shall be obtained and not set aside by the Court, such Commissioners or Commissioner shall, and they and he are and is hereby required to act in Conformity thereto, and to allow or disallow the Claim or Claims thereby determined, according to the Event of such Trial or Trials : Provided always, that all such Determinations of such Commissioners or Commissioner as aforesaid, which shall not be objected to, or which being objected to, the Party or Parties objecting shall not cause such Action at Law to be brought and proceeded in as aforesaid, shall be final, binding, and conclusive upon all Parties whomsoever.

VII. P-ovided always, and be it further enacted, That if any Person or Persons in whose favour any such Determination as aforesaid shall have been made, and against whom any Action or Actions might have been brought if living, shall die before any such Action or Actions shall be brought, and before the Expiration of the Time herein-before limited for bringing the same, it shall be lawful for the Party or Parties determined against and dissatisfied (the Notice in that respect herein-before required to be given having been duly given), to bring such Action or Actions against the Person or Persons so dying, within such limited Time as aforesaid, as if he, she, or they was or were actually living, and to serve the Clerk to such Commissioners or Commissioner with Process for commencing such Action or Actions, in the same Manner as the deceased Person or Persons might have been served therewith if living; and it shall thereupon be incumbent on the Heir or Heirs, or other Person or Persons who shall claim the Benefit of such Determination as aforesaid, to appear and defend such Action or Actions in the Name or Names of the Person or Persons so dead, and Process shall be had therein in the same Manner as if such Person or Persons had been actually living; and the Rights and Interests of all Parties shall be equally bound and concluded by the Event of such Action or Actions.

VIII. Provided also, and be it further enacted, That if any or either of the Parties in any Action to be brought in pursuance of this Act shall die pending the same, such Action shall not abate by reason thereof, but shall be proceeded in as if no such Event had happened, and the Rights and Interests of all Parties shall be equally bound and concluded by the Event of such Action or Actions.

IX. And be it further enacted, That such Commissioners or Commissioner shall, and they and he are and is hereby directed and required, from and out of the said Surplus Money, in the First Place to pay and defray the Costs, Charges, and Expences incident to and attending the obtaining and passing this Act, with lawful Interest for any Money advanced or to be advanced for the Purpose, and in the next Place all other the Costs, Charges, and Expences of them or him such Commissioners or Commissioner, Umpire, Clerks, Agents or Attornies, in carrying the same into Execution.

X. And be it further enacted, That as soon as conveniently may be after the said several Claims shall have been settled and determined in manner herein mentioned, such Commissioners or Commissioner shall, and they and he are and is hereby directed and required to divide and pay over the Remainder of the said Surplus Money unto and amongst the several Persons entitled thereto, according to their respective Rights and Interests therein, and the Receipts of the several and respective Persons to whom such Commissioners or Commissioner or Umpire shall in manner aforesaid adjudge the same to belong, or their Guardian or Guardians, Trustee or Trustees, shall be good, sufficient, and effectual Releases and Discharges to such Commissioners and Commissioner for the Money paid to them respectively, and be sufficient Releases and Release to such Commissioners and Commissioner, each and every of them, of, for, from, and against any Claim or Demand of any Person or Persons whomsoever, of, in, to, for, or in respect of such Surplus Money, or any Part or Parts

thereof respectively, any Clause, Matter, or Thing contained in the said recited Acts to the contrary thereof in anywise notwithstanding; and all such Receipts, together with the Account of the Claims, Rights, and Interests of the said several Persons entitled as aforesaid, shall be kept and deposited with the Clerk of such Commissioners or Commissioner; and the same are hereby declared to be good Evidence for such Commissioners and Commissioner, or any of them, against all Persons whomsoever, in all or any Court or Courts of Law or Equity.

Tenements or Hereditaments, to be settled to the like Uses; and in the meantime and until such Order can be made, such Money may, by Order of the said Court, be laid out in some of the Public Funds or on Government or Real Securities, and the Dividends or Interest arising therefrom shall, by Order of the said Court, be paid to such Person or Persons as would for the Time being be entitled to the Rents and Profits of the Lands, Tenements, or Hereditaments so to be purchased, conveyed, or settled.

XIII. Provided also, and be it further enacted, That where such Money shall be less than Twenty Pounds, then and in such case the same shall be paid to the Use of the Person or Persons who such Commissioners or Commissioner shall adjudge to be entitled thereto, in such Manner as such Commissioners or Commissioner shall think fit; or in case of Infancy, Lunacy, or other Disability or Incapacity, then to his, her, or their Guardian or Guardians, Committee or Committees, Trustee or Trustees, to or for the Use and Benefit of such Person or Persons so entitled respectively.

XIV. And be it further enacted, That this Act shall be printed by the several Printers to the King’s most Excellent Majesty, duly authorized to print the Statutes of the United Kingdom; and a Copy thereof so printed by any of them shall be admitted as Evidence thereof by all Judges, Justices, and others.

GEORGII IV. REGIS.

Cap. 6.

An Act for inclosing Lands in the Parish of North Burton otherwise Cherry Burton, in the East Riding of the County of York.

[12th May 1823.]

r HERE AS there are within the Parish of North Burton otherwise Cherry Burton, in the East Riding of the County of York, several Open and Common Fields, Balks, Commons and Waste Lands, computed to contain in the whole One thousand nine hundred and twenty Acres or thereabouts: And whereas David Burton Fowler Esquire is Lord of the Manor of North Burton otherwise Cherry Burton aforesaid, of which Manor certain Parts of the Lands in the said Parish are holden by Copy of Court Roll, and as such Lord the said David Burton Fowler is also seised of or entitled to the Soil of such Parts of the Balks, Commons and Wastes within the said Parish as are situate within the Limits of that Manor: And whereas William Beverley Esquire is Lord of the Manor of Beverley Chapter, of which Manor other Parts of the Lands within the said Parish are holden by Copy of Court Roll, and as such Lord the said William Beverley is also seised of or entitled to the Soil of such Parts of the Balks, Commons, and Wastes within the said Parish as are situate within the Limits of the said Manor of jBeverley Chapter And whereas the Right Honourable George O'Brien Earl of Egre-monty the said David Burton Fowlerf and several other Persons, are Proprietors of the Lands in the said Open and Common Fields, and entitled to Rights of Common in the said Balks, Commons, and \_Private.~\ u Wastes:

Wastes: Aiul whereas an Act was passed in the Forty-first Year of the Reign of His late Majesty King George the Third, intituled An Act for consolidating in one Act certain Provisions usually inserted in Acts of Inclosure, and for facilitating the Mode of proving the several Facts usually required on the passing of such Acts: And whereas an Act was passed in the Second YTear of the Reign of His present Majesty King George the Fourth, intituled An Act to amend the Law respecting the inclosing of Open Fields, Pastures, Moors, Commons and Waste Lands in England : And whereas the Lands of the respective Proprietors in the said Open and Common Fields lie intermixed and dispersed, and the Cultivation and Management thereof in their present State is inconvenient, and it would tend greatly to the Advantage of the several Proprietors and Persons interested, if the said Open and Common Fields, Balks, Commons and Wastes were divided and inclosed, and specific Parts thereof allotted to the said several Proprietors and Persons interested, in Proportion to their respective Rights and Interests; but such beneficial Purposes cannot be effected without the Aid and Authority of Parliament : May it therefore please Your Majesty that it may be enacted; and be it enacted by the King’s most Excellent Majesty, by and with the Advice and Consent of the Lords Spiritual and Temporal, and Commons, in this present Parliament assembled, and by the Authority of the same, That John Hall of Scarborough in the County of Yon1*, Gentleman, John Lee of Leckonf eld Parks in the said County, Gentleman, and Cornelius Collett of Beverley in the said County, Gentleman, and their Successors to be appointed in Manner herein-after mentioned, shall be, and they are hereby appointed the Commissioners for dividing, allotting, and inclosing the said Open and Common Fields, Balks, Commons and Wastes within the Parish of North Burton otherwise Cherry Burton aforesaid, and for carrying the several other Purposes of this Act into Execution, with such of the Powers, and subject to such of the Clauses and Regulations of the said recited Acts as are not varied or altered or otherwise provided for by this Act.

II. Andbeitfurther enacted, That all Acts, Matters, and Thingsdone by any Two of the said Commissioners, at any Meeting or Meetings of the said Commissioners to be held in pursuance and execution of the Provisions and Directions herein contained, shall to all Intents and Purposes be binding and conclusive, and equally valid and effectual as if the same were transacted by all the said Commissioners : Provided nevertheless, that all the said Commissioners shall be present at the Time of making the Valuation, Division, and Allotment under or by virtue of this or the said first recited Act.

And be it further enacted, That the said Commissioners shall, for Crops, by some Writing or Writings under their Hands, ascertain, order, and appoint what Recompence and Satisfaction in Money shall be made to the Owner or Owners of any Crops of Corn or Grain growing at the Time of the said intended Division and Allotments, for the said Crops, by the Person to whom the Land on which such Crops are growing shall be allotted; the Rector of North Burton otherwise Cherry Burton aforesaid, shall, tobefenjled; for the first Time, be inclosed by and under the Direction of the said Commissioners, with such good and sufficient outer Fences, and such Carriage Gates, and good Oak Posts, and Three good Rails for the same, as the said Commissioners shall deem most proper and necessary, and at the joint Charges of all the other Proprietors, to be ascertained, assessed, and raised by the said Commissioners, in the same Manner as the Costs and Charges of this Act are to be ascertained, assessed, and raised as herein-after mentioned; and all the said Outfences and Carriage Gates shall for ever afterwards be maintained and kept in Repair by the Rector for the Time being, on such Sides or Parts as the said Commissioners shall award, order, and direct.

XXVII. And be it further enacted, That it shall be lawful for the and laid said Commissioners, and they are hereby authorized and empowered to together, set out, allot, and award unto and for the said Rector of North Burton otherwise Cherry Burton aforesaid, and his Successors, in lieu of and

XXX. And be it further enacted, That if any Person shall, from and after the Execution of the said Award of the said Commissioners, turn or put, or cause to be turned or put, or knowingly suffer to be turned or put any of his, her, or their Horses, Asses, Mules, Beasts, Sheep, Lambs, Swine, Cattle, or Geese into any of the Roads to be set out by virtue of the said first recited Act and this Act, which shall be fenced on both Sides thereof, it shall be lawful for the Person or Persons whose Hedges, Fences, Crops, or Grounds shall be damaged thereby, or any other Person or Persons, to impound the same; and that after the Execution of the said Award of the said Commissioners the Herbage and Produce as well of the Roads to be set out as aforesaid, as of the Ground to be set out as aforesaid for getting Stone, Lime, Gravel, and other Materials for the Repairs of the Highways, shall be vested in the Surveyor or Surveyors of the Highways of the said Parish for the Time being, and shall by him or them be publicly let to the best Bidder or Bidders, for the Purpose of mowing or depasturing, under such Regulations as the said Surveyor or Surveyors shall from Time to Time appoint, and the Rents and Profits thereof shall be applied towards the Reparation of the several Highways within the Parish of North Burton otherwise Cherry Burton aforesaid, and shall be accounted for by the Surveyor or Surveyors of the Highways in the same Parish annually, on or about the First Day of October, at a Vestry or other Public Meeting to be called for that Purpose, in the said Parish of North Burton otherwise Cherry Burton; and such Surveyors shall account for the Rents and Profits thereof in the same Manner as they are accountable for other Money that shall come to their Hands, as Surveyors of the Highways, and shall be subject and liable to the like Penalties for Neglect or Default thereof.

XXXI. And be it further enacted, That where the Proprietor or Proprietors of any Lands or other Hereditaments which shall be allotted, partitioned, or exchanged by virtue of this or the said first recited Act, shall hold their respective Lands or Hereditaments by different Tenures, or for different Estates, or under different Titles, the said Commissioners shall ascertain and distinguish the Lands or other Hereditaments held by each of such Tenures, for each of such Estates, and under each of such Titles respectively, and shall accordingly in the said Award set out and distinguish distinct and several Allotments for such respective Lands or other Hereditaments; and where from the want of the necessary Information before the said Commissioners, or from any other Cause, their Award shall omit discriminating as herein-before is mentioned such different Titles and different Estates, and different Tenures, and at any Time within the Space of Five Years from and after the making of the said Award request shall be made to the said Commissioners by any Person or Persons interested, by Writing, under his, her, or their Hand or Hands, to have such Omission supplied by a separate Instrument or Instruments, then and in every such Case

XXXIV. And be it further enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Rector of the said Rectory for the Time being, by Indenture or Indentures under his Hand and Seal, with the Consent and Approbation of the Archbishop of the Diocese, and of the Patron of the said Rectory respectively, to lease or demise all or any Part or Parts of' the Allotment or Allotments to be set out and allotted to such Rector, by virtue of this Act, to any Person or Persons whomsoever, for any Term or Terms not exceeding Twenty-one Years, to commence within Twelve Calendar Months next after the passing of this Act, so that the Rent or respective Rents for the same shall be thereby reserved and made payable to the same Rector for the Time being, by Four equal Quarterly Payments in every Year, and so that there be also reserved and made payable to such Rector the best and most improved Rent or Rents that can be reasonably had or gotten for the same, without taking any Fine, Foregift, Premium, Sum of Money or other Consideration for the making or granting any such Lease or Demise, and so that no such Lessee, by any such Lease or Demise, be made dispunishable for Waste by any express Words to be therein contained, and so that there be inserted in any such Lease a Power of Re-entry on Non-payment of the Rent or Rents to be thereby reserved, within a reasonable Time, to be therein limited, after the same shall have become due, and so that a Counterpart of each and every such Lease be duly executed by the Lessee or Lessees to whom such Lease or Leases shall be so made as aforesaid; and every such Lease shall be valid and effectual, any thing in the said recited Acts, or any Law or Usage to the contrary notwithstanding.

XXXV. Provided always, and be it further enacted, That in case any such Lease or Leases so to be granted as aforesaid, shall by any Means become forfeited or void, or be surrendered before the Expiration of the Term granted by such Lease, then and in such Case, and as often as the same shall happen, it shall be lawful for the Rector of the said Rectory for the Time being, by and with the Consent and Approbation of the Archbishop of the Diocese and of the Patron of the said Rectory for the Time being respectively, to grant a new Lease of or to demise all or any Part or Parts of the Allotment or Allotments to be set out and allotted to such Rector as aforesaid; such last mentioned Lease to continue for such Term of

XLII. And be it further enacted, That the Award and all separate Award. Instruments supplemental thereto, to be made by the said Commissioners in Manner directed by this and the said first recited Act, shall, within the Space of Twelve Calendar Months from the Execution thereof, be inrolled in the Public Register Office at Beverley in the East Riding of the said County of York; and the Registrar of the said Office, or his Deputy for the Time being, shall, and he and they is and are hereby directed to enrol or cause the same to be inrolled in one of the Books used for enrolling Bargains and Sales of Lands in the said Office accordingly; and a true Copy (to be signed by the said Commissioners) of the Map or Plan annexed to such Award, shall be lodged at the said Register Office at the Time of the Enrolment of the said Award, and there kept for ever; and the said Award, together with the Map or Plan thereto annexed, shall immediately after the Enrolment of such Award be put into and kept in a Tin Box, and be lodged for safe Custody in the Chest of the Parish Church of North Burton otherwise Cherry Burton aforesaid, forever, for the Inspection and Perusal of the several Persons interested therein, or their respective Agents, who shall be at Liberty to inspect and peruse the same, on Application for such Purpose at all seasonable Times, and to make or take Copies or Extracts therefrom; and the said Registrar shall be entitled to such Fees for the Enrol ment of the said Award and Instruments respectively, as he is entitled to for enrolling any Bargain and Sale; and the said Registrar, or his Deputy for the Time being, shall permit any Person or Persons whomsoever from Time to Time within the Office Hours of Attendance, to peruse the Enrolment of the said Award and Instruments at the Register Office, and to inspect and examine such Copy of the said Map or Plan, paying for the same to such Registrar or his Deputy the Sum of One Shilling and no more; and shall also from Time to Time, on Request to him made by any Person or Persons whomsoever, cause a true Copy of the whole or any Part or Parts of the Enrolment of the said Award or other Instrument, to be made and written out from such Enrolment; and shall from Time to Time when requested certify the same under his Hand to be a true Copy from such Enrolment, for which the said Registrar or his Deputy making the same shall be paid after the Rate of Sixpence per Sheet, reckoning One hundred Words to each Sheet, and no more

Appeal.

XLIII. And be it further enacted, That if any Person or Persons shall think himself herself, or themselves aggrieved by any thing done or omitted to be done in pursuance of the said recited Acts or of this Act, (other than and except such Acts, Orders, and Determinations of the said Commissioners as in and by this and the said first recited Act are directed to be final and conclusive, or where an Issue at Law shall be tried as hereinbefore-mentioned), he, she, or they may appeal at the General Quarter Sessions of the Peace to be holden for the said East Riding of the County of York within Six Calendar Months next after the Cause of Complaint shall have arisen, on giving to the said Commissioners and to the Party or Parties concerned Thirty Days Notice in Writing of such Appeal, and of the Matter thereof; and the Justices not interested in the Premises, in their said General Quarter Sessions are hereby required to hear and determine the Matter of every such Appeal, and to make such Order therein, and award such Costs and Damages as to them in their Discretion shall seem reasonable, and by their Order or Warrant to levy the Costs and Damages which shall be so awarded, by Distress and Sale of the Goods and Chattels of the Party or Parties liable to pay the same, rendering the Overplus (if any) on Demand to the Owner or Owners of such Goods and Chattels, after deducting the reasonable Charges of such Warrant, Distress, and Sale; and the Determination of the said Justices shall be final and conclusive on all Parties concerned, and shall not be removed by Certiorari, or any other Writ or Process whatsoever into any of His Majesty's Courts of Record at Westminster or elsewhere; but in case such Appeal shall appear to the said Justices to be frivolous, vexatious, or without Foundation, then the said Justices shall award such Costs to be paid by the Appellant or Appellants as to them in their Discretion shall seem reasonable, and to be levied in Manner aforesaid.

XLIV. Provided always, and be it further enacted, That nothing in this Act contained shall extend or be construed to extend to prejudice, lessen, defeat, or affect the Right, Title, or Interest of the Lord of the said Manor of North Burton otherwise Cherry Burton, or any future Lord or Lords, Lady or Ladies of the said Manor, in and to the Seigniories, Rights, Royalties, Privileges and Services incident or belonging thereto, (other than such as are meant and intended to be compensated for, barred, and extinguished by this Act,) but that the Lord or Lords, Lady or Ladies of the same Manor, shall and may from Time to Time and at all Times for ever hereafter hold, receive, take, exercise and enjoy all Rents, Fines, Services and Profits, and all Seigniories, Rights, Royalties and Privileges whatsoever to the same Manor, incident, appendant, belonging, or appertaining, (other than and except as aforesaid,) in as full, ample, and beneficial a Manner as he, she, or they could or might

ANNO QUARTO

GEORGII IV. REGIS.

Cap. 7.

An Act for inclosing Lands in the Parish of Ryton in the County of Durham.

[23d May 1823.]

WHEREAS there are within the Parish of Ryton in the County of Durham several Commons, Moors, or Tracts of Waste Ground herein-after mentioned, that is to say, in the Township of Winlaton, certain Commons, Moors, or Tracts of Waste Ground called Barlow Fell, Beda Hills, and the Wastes of the Manor of Winlaton otherwise Winlington, containing together, by Estimation, Four hundred Acres or thereabouts; in the Township of Ryton Woodside, a certain Common, Moor, or Tract of Waste Ground called Woodside Common, containing by Estimation Six Acres or thereabouts; and in the Township of Ryton, a certain other Common, Moor, or Tract of Waste Ground called Barmoor, containing, by Estimation, Fifty Acres or thereabouts; and certain Fields, Closes, or Parcels of Ground called The Hall Banks, The Paddock Hill Field, The Three Strother Closes, and Parson's Haugh, containing together, by Estimation, Sixty-five Acres or thereabouts, which are subject to certain Commonable Rights : And whereas Peregrine Edward Towneley Esquire, Thomas Richard Beaumont Esquire and Diana his Wife, Ann Simpson Spinster, The Most Honorable John Crichton Marquis of Buie, The Most Honorable Francis Charles Marquis of Hertford, Mary Dowager Countess of Strathmore, Henry Jadis Esquire, The Reverend James Blackburn Clerk, James Fairer Esquire, James Dundas Esquire, James Farrer Steadman Esquire, and Sir John Dean Paul Baronet, (the said Mary Countess of Strathmore, Henry Jadis, James Blackburn, James Farrer, James Dundas, James Fanner Stead-[Private.] fr fr man9

and The Reverend Charles Thorp Clerk is Rector thereof, and as such is entitled to all the Tythes, both Great and Small, and other Dues and Payments arising, renewing, increasing, happening, and payable within the Parish of Ryton aforesaid: And whereas an Act was passed in the Forty-first Year of the Reign of His late Majesty King George the Third, intituled An Act for consolidating in one Act certain Provisions usually inserted 41G.3.C. 109. in Acts of Inclosure; and for facilitating the Mode of proving the several Facts usually required on passing of such Acts : And whereas another Act was passed in the First and Second Years of the Reign of His present Majesty King George the Fourth, intituled An Act to amend l & 2 G. 4. the Law respecting the inclosing of Open Fields, Pastures, Moors, Com- c* 23» mons, and Waste Lands in England : And whereas the said several Proprietors of Lands, Messuages, Tenements and Hereditaments, having Right of Common upon the said Commons, Moors, or Tracts of Waste Ground respectively, and having such Right of Intercommon as aforesaid, are desirous that the same should respectively be divided, allotted and inclosed, and the said Right of Intercommon sold and disposed of in Manner herein-after mentioned: But as such Division, Allotment, Inclosure, and Sale cannot be effectually completed and established without the Aid and Authority of Parliament, may it therefore please Your Majesty that it may be enacted; and be it enacted by the King's most Excellent Majesty, by and with the Advice and Consent of the Lords Spiritual and Temporal, and Commons, in this present Parliament assembled, and by the Authority of the same, That Thomas Bell of the Town and County of Newcastle upon Commis-Tyne, Gentleman, shall be and he is hereby appointed sole Commissioner ap-sioner for setting out, dividing, allotting, and inclosing the said several Poinled-Commons, Moors, or Tracts of Waste Ground respectively, and for putting this Act in Execution, in such Manner, and subject to such Regulations as are herein-after contained, and with such of the Powers, and subject to such of the Rules, Orders, Directions, Authorities, Regulations,

gulations, Restrictions, and Provisions contained in the said recited Acts, as are not controlled by or repugnant to any of the Clauses, Provisions, or Regulations contained in this Act.

Power to appoint new Commissioners.

II. And be it further enacted, That if the said Thomas Bell shall die or refuse to act, or become incapable of acting as a Commissioner in the Execution of this Act, before all the Powers, Authorities, and Trusts hereby reposed in him shall be finally executed and performed, it shall be lawful for the major Part in Value, such Value to be ascertained by the Poor’s Rate Assessment, of the Persons interested in the said Division and Inclosure, or their respective Agents or Attornies, present at a Meeting to be hoi den for that Purpose, by Writing under their respective Hands, to nominate and appoint one other fit and proper Person, not interested in the Premises, to be a Commissioner in the Place of the said Thomas Bell; provided that Fourteen Days Notice of the Time, Place, and Purpose of such Meeting shall be given by Two or more of such Persons in like Manner as herein-after is directed with respect to the sitting of the said Commissioner; and that such Meeting shall be held within the Township of Winlaton aforesaid, or within Eight Miles thereof; and if any Commissioner or Commissioners who shall be appointed in the Place and Stead of the said Thomas Bell shall die, or refuse to act, or become incapable of acting, such future Vacancy shall in like Manner be filled up by the major Part in Value of the Persons interested in the said Division and Inclosure.

V. And be it further enacted, That the Surveys or Admeasurements, including all necessary Re-surveys and all Plans (except the fair Flan upon Vellum herein-after particularly mentioned) shall be paid for at and after the Rate of One Shilling per Acre for each and every Acre of the Land Which shall be surveyed, admeasured, and planned in pursuance of this Act, and the said Surveyor shall at all Times bear his own Expences; and in case of the Death of any such Surveyor before such Surveys, Admeasurements, and Plans as aforesaid shall be finished, then and in every such Case the Executors or Administrators of every such Surveyor so dying, shall be paid after the Rate of Sixpence per Acre for each and every Acre which shall have been so surveyed and admeasured in his Life-time.

VI. And be it further enacted, That the said Surveyor shall, after the said Division and Allotment of the Lands and Grounds intended to be hereby divided and inclosed shall be completed, make a fair Plan or Plans, upon Vellum, of all the said Lands and Grounds intended to be hereby divided and allotted, whereon shall be truly and distinctly delineated, set down, marked and expressed the several Matters and Things necessary and proper to be inserted therein, for the better explaining the Award of the said Commissioner; and for which fair Plan or Plans so to be made as aforesaid the Sum of Thirty Poundp shall1 be,paid, and no more.

IX. And be it further enacted, That all other Notices necessary or required to be given by or in pursuance of this Act, or by or in pursuance of the said first recited Act, shall be given and published in the said Paper called The Newcastle Courant, or in some other Newspaper usually circulated in the said County of Durham; and that at all Meetings whatever holden under or in pursuance of this Act, all Parties attending the same shall pay their own Expences.

X. And be it further enacted, That if any Dispute or Difference shall arise between any of the Parties interested or claiming to be interested in the said intended Division, Allotment and Inclosure, touching or concerning any Right or Interest which they or any of them shall have or claim to have in or to the said Commons, Moors, or Tracts of Waste Ground, or touching or concerning any other Matter or Thing relating to the said Division, Allotment and Inclosure, it shall be lawful for the Commissioner for the Time being, and he is hereby authorized and required to examine, hear, and de-mine the same; provided always, that nothing herein contained shall authorize the said Commissioner to determine the Title to any Messuages, Lands, Tenements, or Hereditaments whatsoever; and provided also, that nothing in this Act contained shall extend to enable the said Commissioner for the Time being to determine the Right between any Parties contrary to the Possession of any such Parties (except in Cases of Encroachments as herein-after mentioned); but in case the said Commissioner shall be of Opinion against the Right of the Person or Persons so in Possession, he shall forbear to make any Determination thereupon until the Possession shall have been given up by such Person or Persons, or recovered from such Person or Persons by Ejectment or other due Course of Law.

XI. And be it further enacted, That in case the Commissioner for the Time being shall, upon the Hearing and Determination of any Claim or Claims, Objection or Objections, to be delivered to him in pursuance of this or the said first recited Act, see Cause to award any Costs, it shall and may be lawful to and for the said Commissioner, and he is hereby empowered, upon Application made to him for that Purpose, to settle, assess, and award such Costs and Charges as he shall think reasonable, to be paid to the Party or

Parties

103

4° GEORGII IV. Cap.7.

Parties in whose Favor any Determination of the said Commissioner shall be made, by the Person or Persons, Body or Bodies Politic, Corporate or Collegiate, whose Claim or Claims, Objection or Objections shall be thereby disallowed or overruled; and in case the Person or Persons, Body or Bodies Politic, Corporate or Collegiate, who shall be liable to pay such Costs and Charges, shall neglect or refuse to pay the same, on Demand, then and in such Case it shall and may be lawful to and for the said Commissioner, and he is hereby authorized and required, by Warrant under his Hand and Seal, directed to any Person whomsoever, to cause such Costs and Charges to be levied by Distress and Sale of the Goods and Chattels of the Person or Persons, Body or Bodies Politic, Corporate or Collegiate, so neglecting or refusing to pay the same, rendering the Overplus (if any) upon Demand, to the Person or Persons, Body or Bodies Politic, Corporate or Collegiate, whose Goods and-Chattels shall have been so distrained and sold, after deducting the Costs and Charges attending such Distress and Sale.

XII. Provided always, and be it further enacted, That in case any Person or Persons, Body or Bodies Politic, Corporate or Collegiate, interested or claiming to be interested in the said intended Division, Allotment and Inclosure, shall be dissatisfied with any Determination of the Commissioner for the Time being, touching or concerning any Claim or Claims to any Right of Common, or other Right or Interest in, over, or upon the Lands and Grounds hereby directed to be divided, allotted and inclosed, or any Part thereof, or any Objection or Objections to such Claim or Claims, it shall and may be lawful to and for the Person or Persons, Body or Bodies Politic, Corporate or Collegiate, so dissatisfied, to bring or cause to be brought any Action or Actions at Law, in one of His Majesty's Courts of Record at Westminster, against the Person or Persons, Body or Bodies Politic, Corporate or Collegiate, in whose Favor such Determination shall have been made, within Three Calendar Months next after the Determination of the said Commissioner shall have been notified, in Writing, to the Party or Parties against whom such Determination shall have been so made, or to his, her, or their known Agent or Attorney; and the Defendant or Defendants in such Action or Actions shall, and he or they is and are hereby required to name an Attorney or Attornies, who shall appear thereto, or file Common Bail, and accept one or more Issue or Issues, whereby such Claim or Claims, and the Right or Rights thereby insisted upon may be tried and determined, (such Issue or Issues to be settled by the proper Officer of the Court in which the said Action shall be commenced, in case the Parties shall differ about the same), and may be tried at the then next or the following Assizes for the County of Durham, after the Commencement of such Action; and the Verdict or Verdicts which shall be given in such Action or Actions shall be final, binding, and conclusive upon all and every Person and Persons, Body and Bodies Politic, Corporate, and Collegiate, unless the Court in which such Action or Actions shall be brought shall set aside such Verdict or Verdicts, and order a new Trial to be had therein, which it shall be lawful for the Court to do, as is usual in other Cases; and after such Verdict or Verdicts shall be obtained, and not set aside by the

XIII. Provided always, and be it further enacted, That if any of the Parties, Plaintiffs or Defendants, in any Action to be brought in pursuance of this Act, shall die pending the same, such Action shall not abate by reason thereof, but shall be proceeded in as if no such Event had happened; and that no such Difference, Action, or Proceeding as aforesaid, nor any Difference, Dispute, or Proceeding touching the Title to any Lands, Tenements, or Hereditaments within the said Parish of Ryion, shall impede or delay the said Commissioner in the Execution of this Act and the said recited Acts, but such Division, Allotment, and Inclosure shall be proceeded in notwithstanding any such Difference, Suit, or Proceeding.

XIV. Provided always, and be it further enacted, That if any Person or Persons in whose Favor any such Determination as aforesaid shall have been made, and against whom any such Action or Actions might have been brought, if living, shall happen to die before any such Action or Actions shall have been brought, and before the Expiration of the Time herein-before limited for bringing the same, it shall be lawful for the Person or Persons, Bodies Politic, Corporate, or Collegiate, who might have brought such Action or Actions against the Person or Persons so dying, to bring the same within the Time so limited as aforesaid, against such Person or Persons as if actually living, and to serve the Clerk of the said Commissioner with Process for commencing such Action or Actions, in the same Manner as the Party or Parties so dying might have been served therewith if living, and it shall thereupon be incumbent on the Heir or Heirs, or other Person or Persons who shall claim the Benefit of such Determination as aforesaid, to appear and defend such Action or Actions in the Name or Names of the Person or Persons so dead, and Proceedings shall be had therein in the same Manner as if such Person or Persons had been actually living, and the Rights of all Parties sffall be equally bound and concluded by the Event of such Action or Actionsc

XXI. XXII. And be it further enacted, That the said Commissioner shall in the next Place set out and allot all the Residue of the said Moor, Common, or Tract of Waste Ground called Woodside Common, unto the Churchwardens and Overseers of the Poor for the Time being of the said Township of Ryton Woodside, to be by them employed and cultivated for the Useof the Poor of the said Township, and in relief of the Inhabitants rateable for their Support; and the said Commissioner shall then set out and allot all the several Residues of the said several Moors, Commons, or Tracts of Waste Ground, called Barlow Fell, Beda Hills, the Wastes of the Manor of Winlaton otherwise Winlington, and Barmoor respectively, unto and amongst the several Persons, Bodies Politic and Corporate, having Rights of Common on the same respectively, in proportion and according to the annual Value of the Lands, Tenements, Estates, and Interests in respect of which they may severally be entitled to such Right of Common, such annual Value to be ascertained by the said Commissioner in such Manner as he shall think fit: Provided always, that all Houses and Buildings not occupied with some Farm of Land containing Twenty Acres, shall be valued separately from the Lands, Garths, and Gardens, and the Allotments to be made in respect of such Houses and Buildings, shall be less by One-third than the Allotments to be made in respect of any Lands, Garths, and Gardens of equal Value $ but no separate Valuation shall be made of any Houses or

Buildings

4° GEORGII IV. f 107

Buildings which were occupied with and were Part and Parcel of any Farm of Land at the Time of the passing of this Act containing Twenty Acres or more, but all such last-mentioned Houses and Buildings shall be considered as included in the Valuation of the Lands constituting such Farm to which they belong; and that all Mills (if any) having Right of Common on the said Commons, Moors, or Tracts of Waste Ground respectively intended to be hereby divided, shall be also separately valued, and the Allotments to be made in respect of such Mills shall be less by One-third, in proportion to the Value of such Mills, than the Allotments to be made in respect of Lands and Grounds.

Moor, or Tract of Waste Ground called Barmoor.

sons whomsoever, for any Term not exceeding Twenty-one Years, to commence within Twelve Calendar Months next after the passing of this Act, so that the Rent or Rents for the same shall be thereby reserved to the Rector for the Time being, by Quarterly Payments in every Year, and so there be thereby also reserved and made payable to such Rector the best and most improved Rent or Rents that can be reasonably had or gotten for the same, without taking any Fine, Foregift, Premium, Sum of Money, or other Consideration for making or granting such Lease or Demise, and so as that no such Lessee, by any such Lease or Demise, be made dispunishable for Waste by any express Words to be therein contained, and so that there be inserted in every such Lease, Power of Re-entry on Nonpayment of the Rent or Rents to be thereby reserved, within a reasonable Time, to be therein limited, after the same shall become due, and so that a Counter-part of such Lease be duly executed by the Lessee or Lessees to whom such Lease shall be so made as aforesaid; and every such Lease shall be valid and effectual, any thing in the said recited Acts, or any Law or Usage to the contrary notwithstanding: Provided always, that whenever any Lease or Leases so to be granted by any such Rector shall by any means become forfeited or void, or be surrendered before the Expiration by Effluxion of Time of the Term or Terms thereby granted, then and in such Case, and as often as the same shall so happen, it shall and may be lawful for such Rector for the Time being, by and with such Consent and Approbation as herein-before mentioned, to grant a new Lease of the Lands so demised for such Term or Terms of Years as shall, at the Time or Times of such Avoidance, be then to come and unexpired, of the original Lease or Leases, subject nevertheless to the Provisions and Conditions contained in such original Lease or Leases, and then remaining unperformed and capable of taking effect.

XXVIII. And be it further enacted, That the several Allotments to be set out and allotted to the Rector of Ryton for the Time being, as an Equivalent or Compensation for Tythes, and in respect of the Glebe Lands of the Rectory of Ryton aforesaid, shall be respectively inclosed, hedged, and fenced by the said Commissioner, or such Person or Persons as he shall appoint so to fence the same; and the Expellees of such inclosing, hedging, and fencing the said several Allotments shall be paid and defrayed out of the Monies to be raised for the Purpose of carrying this Act into Execution, in such Proportions and in such Manner as the said Commissioner shall direct; and after making such Inclosures, Hedges, and Fences, the same shall be for ever after kept in Repair by the said Rector and his Successors, and the Owner or Owners of any adjoining Allotment or Allotments, in such Shares and Proportions as the said Commissioner shall by his Award direct; and the several other Allotments to be made by virtue of this Act shall be inclosed, hedged, ditched, and fenced at the Expence of the respective Proprietors to whom such Fences shall be allotted or directed to belong, with Ditches and Quickset Hedges, or in such other Manner, and within such Time, as the said Commissioner shall by his Award direct or appoint.

and all and every such Exchange or Exchanges so to be made shall be good, valid, and effectual in the Law, to all Intent and Purposes whatsoever; provided that no such Exchange shall be made of any Lands, Tenements, or Hereditaments held in Right of any Church, Chapel, or other Ecclesiastical Benefice, without the Consent testified as aforesaid of the Patron thereof, and of the Bishop of the Diocese in which such Lands, Tenements, or Hereditaments so to be exchanged shall lie or be situate. lo eutiiv
